title: Kmeans Extract Frames - ValueError: Input contains NaN
body:
**Describe the bug** When using the gui to 'extract frames' via kmeans algorithm (but not uniform), I receive the error "ValueError: Input contains NaN, infinity or a value too large for dtype('float64')." I have only tried this via the GUI (rather than using the extract frames function directly); not sure if there would be a difference? **Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):** - OS: MacOS 10.15.7 - DeepLabCut Version 2.1.10.2 (from within git cloned DeepLabCut; latest git pull was this morning) - DeepLabCut mode multi-animal tracking - environment DLC_CPU **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior, i.e.: 1. pythonw; import deeplabcut; deeplabcut_launch_dlc() 2. Created new project with a loaded video (symlinked) 3. Go to Extract Frames tab; specify kmeans 4. See error:
TRACEBACK

```python ^do not delete the above "

TRACEBACK

" or the ```python part! Config file read successfully. Extracting frames based on kmeans ... Kmeans-quantization based extracting of frames from 0.0 seconds to 51.67 seconds. Extracting and downsampling... 775 frames from the video. 775it [01:35, 8.13it/s] Kmeans clustering ... (this might take a while) /Users/kperks/opt/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/core/_methods.py:75: RuntimeWarning: invalid value encountered in reduce ret = umr_sum(arr, axis, dtype, out, keepdims) /Users/kperks/DeepLabCut/deeplabcut/utils/frameselectiontools.py:386: RuntimeWarning: invalid value encountered in subtract data = DATA - DATA.mean(axis=0) /Users/kperks/opt/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/core/fromnumeric.py:86: RuntimeWarning: overflow encountered in reduce return ufunc.reduce(obj, axis, dtype, out, **passkwargs) Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/kperks/DeepLabCut/deeplabcut/gui/extract_frames.py", line 241, in extract_frames slider_width=slider_width, File "/Users/kperks/DeepLabCut/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/frame_extraction.py", line 306, in extract_frames color=cluster_color, File "/Users/kperks/DeepLabCut/deeplabcut/utils/frameselectiontools.py", line 392, in KmeansbasedFrameselectioncv2 kmeans.fit(data) File "/Users/kperks/opt/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/cluster/_kmeans.py", line 1662, in fit order='C', accept_large_sparse=False) File "/Users/kperks/opt/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/base.py", line 421, in _validate_data X = check_array(X, **check_params) File "/Users/kperks/opt/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/utils/validation.py", line 63, in inner_f return f(*args, **kwargs) File "/Users/kperks/opt/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/utils/validation.py", line 664, in check_array allow_nan=force_all_finite == 'allow-nan') File "/Users/kperks/opt/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/utils/validation.py", line 106, in _assert_all_finite msg_dtype if msg_dtype is not None else X.dtype) ValueError: Input contains NaN, infinity or a value too large for dtype('float64'). do not delete below this line, leave the blank line and the ``` ```

**Expected behavior** Frames to be extracted with no error **Additional context** It seems like I have run into this problem before. One solution was to work from the latest version via git clone. Sometimes this error does not occur, but sometimes it does. I cannot figure out anything different on our end that correlates with this error or not. Any ideas? Thank you so much as always for your help!
